It was initially created to be able to easily backup or create a distributable copy of an Ubuntu or derivative installation. Inspiration for this tool came from the [[mklivecd]] script that Mandriva uses and the remasterme script that is in [[PCLinuxOS]]. Since those scripts are were not easy to port to ubuntu (it wasn't compatible with casper and ubiquity and used too many Mandriva specific things), it was created from scratch.
<br> <br> It is very useful to create a customized Live CD/DVD version of Ubuntu, one just as to install ubuntu, install all the programs needed, including codecs, etc... install updates (recommended), and then install and run the script to create a Live CD/DVD with much more functionality than a original Ubuntu Live CD, the resulting [[ISO_image|iso]] can also the later installed in a USB pendrive <ref>http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2007/09/28/usb-ubuntu-710-gutsy-gibbon-install/</ref>.
